---

I found the issue! The problem is a **case sensitivity mismatch** between the file path in your code and the actual file structure:

**In your code (Navbar.tsx):**
```typescript
src="/branding/svg/neo14Logo.svg"
```

**Actual file structure:**
```
public/branding/SVG/neo14Logo.svg
```

The directory is `SVG` (uppercase) but your code references `svg` (lowercase). This works on Windows during development because Windows file systems are case-insensitive, but Vercel's Linux-based deployment environment is case-sensitive, so the file won't be found.

Let me fix this by updating the path in the Navbar component:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: app/components/Navbar.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 1, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -173,5 +173,5 @@
            &lt;Link href=&quot;/&quot; aria-label=&quot;Cospace home&quot; className=&quot;flex items-center group&quot;&gt;
              &lt;Image 
-               src=&quot;/branding/svg/neo14Logo.svg&quot; 
+               src=&quot;/branding/SVG/neo14Logo.svg&quot; 
                alt=&quot;Cospace by NEO14&quot; 
                width={120} 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---

---

Perfect! I've fixed the case sensitivity issue. The problem was that your code was referencing `/branding/svg/neo14Logo.svg` (lowercase "svg") but the actual directory is `/branding/SVG/` (uppercase "SVG").

## Summary

**The Issue:** Case sensitivity mismatch between your code and file structure
- **Code:** `/branding/svg/neo14Logo.svg` (lowercase)
- **Actual:** `/branding/SVG/neo14Logo.svg` (uppercase)

**Why it worked locally but not on Vercel:**
- **Windows (local):** Case-insensitive file system - both paths work
- **Linux (Vercel):** Case-sensitive file system - exact case must match

**The Fix:** Updated both instances in `Navbar.tsx` to use the correct uppercase path `/branding/SVG/neo14Logo.svg`

This should resolve the logo loading issue on your Vercel deployment. The logo will now load properly in both the desktop and mobile navigation menus.
